comments:
build i0410

I was trying to reproduce the problem in bug 160290 (they have bundles in their target without version numbers in the filenames) so I took an Eclipse install and removed the version numbers from the filenames. But when I tried to start this build, I got an error saying that the executable could not find its companion shared library.

Renaming the equinox.launcher bundle and fragment to include a "_1" at the end resulted in a crash (will attach dialog) with no error log.

Note how some of the command-line args are duplicated in the dialog. Is this intentional? Also I swear there was a reference to startup.jar in the first dialog I got but I don't see it there in the later ones.

After the rename, I got the following in the log file before it gave me the above dialog.

!SESSION Thu Apr 12 13:47:08 EDT 2007 ------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.equinox.launcher 4 0 2007-04-12 13:47:08.613
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not find framework
	at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:782)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:403)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:1139)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:1114)
Sounds similar to the issues described in bug 152154.
